title: 4 shot, 2 critically injured in south Nashville drive-by shooting
content:
NASHVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
Four people were injured in a drive-by shooting in south Nashville on Sunday night.
Police said a red Nissan Sentra was targeted by gunfire on the 100 block of Rains Avenue just after 7 p.m.
The four victims, who were all inside the vehicle, were taken to Vanderbilt University Medical Center.
Rear seat passengers Michael Shaw, 32, and Michael Myers Jr., 25, were critically injured.
Driver Dameisha Clark, 20, and front seat passenger Kayla Blakley, 25, have non-critical injuries.
Detectives said someone in a black sedan with custom rims pulled up next to the Sentra and opened fire.
Police are working to identify the people in the sedan and figure out the motive behind the shooting.
